definition: to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself

sentences.english: He showed his remarkable endurance throughout the courtship.
sentences.chinese: 他在求爱期间展现了非凡的忍耐力。

sentences.english: And yes, carbohydrate is the essential fuel for prolonged endurance activity.
sentences.chinese: 当然，碳水化合物是延长忍耐力必要的燃料。

sentences.english: To succeed you must have a vast amount of enduring patience.
sentences.chinese: 想要成功，你一定要有出众的忍耐力。

sentences.english: There’s an endurance-test aspect to all of this.
sentences.chinese: 这也是一种忍耐力的考验。

sentences.english: Finally, these animals have a higher tolerance for carbon dioxide (CU2).
sentences.chinese: 最后，这些动物对二氧化碳具有更高的忍耐力。

sentences.english: Tolerance is a notch above intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 忍耐力较诸脑力，尤胜一筹。

sentences.english: It can improve flexibility, strength, balance, and stamina.
sentences.chinese: 它提高人的柔韧性，力量，平衡感，还有忍耐力。

sentences.english: I think it depends on your own tolerance.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这取决于你自己的忍耐力。

sentences.english: Female amphipods were more tolerant both to lower and higher temperature than the male.
sentences.chinese: 雄性个体对极限温度的忍耐力低于雌性。

sentences.english: and then he came back and he's, he was more resilient than, you know, than before.
sentences.chinese: 然后他回来了，比以前更有忍耐力。

sentences.english: Once you lose your patience, things tend to go badly.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你失去了忍耐力，事情将趋向于变得更糟。

sentences.english: It is an event full of incredible human achievement and endurance.
sentences.chinese: 这是一项充满不可思议的人类极限和忍耐力的盛事。

definition: to endure/to bear with/to exercise patience/to restrain oneself/patience/endurance
